clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Energy Density on Liking and on Caloric Adjustment Conditioning
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Energy Density on Liking and on Caloric Adjustment Conditioning After Sweet Beverage Exposure in Children Aged 8-11 y

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre des Sciences du Goût et de l'Alimentation

clinical_study.source: Centre des Sciences du Goût et de l'Alimentation

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective is to study, in 8-11 year old children, the influence of energy density conditioning on liking for new flavored beverages and on caloric adjustment after the beverage consumption. The stability of the energy conditioning was evaluated after a period without exposure and after an extinction period during which the energy density of the beverages was changed.

primary_outcome.measure: Flavored beverages liking and preference before the conditioning period (T0)
primary_outcome.description: Liking and preference measurements for the flavored beverages, before the conditioning period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Energy adjustment before the conditioning period (T0)
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of energy intake at the lunch following the beverage consumption, before the conditioning period

other_outcome.measure: Flavored beverages liking and preference after the conditioning period (T1)
other_outcome.description: Liking and preference measurements for the new flavored beverages, after the 4-week conditioning period.

other_outcome.description: liking and preference measurements of the new flavored beverages, after a period of 3 weeks without exposure (=stability period)

clinical_study.condition: Conditioning of Caloric Adjustment and Liking in Children

arm_group.description: During the conditioning period, the children of this group was exposed only twice to the beverages
During the conditioning period, children of this group were exposed exposed 7 times to the beverages

intervention.description: During this study, children were exposed to 2 flavored sweetened beverages: a high energy version (HE: 150kcal) and a no energy version (NE: 0kcal). During a 4-wk conditioning period, children were exposed either 2 times to each beverage. After a 3-wk stability period without exposure, children were exposed 3 times to both beverages in which the association between the flavor and the energy density had been switched (4-wk extinction period).

During this study, children were exposed to 2 flavored sweetened beverages: a high energy version (HE: 150kcal) and a no energy version (NE: 0kcal). During a 4-wk conditioning period, children were exposed either 7 times to each beverage. After a 3-wk stability period without exposure, children were exposed 3 times to both beverages in which the association between the flavor and the energy density had been switched (4-wk extinction period).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- regularly ate at the school canteen
- returned signed consent from parents
Exclusion Criteria:
- present health problems, food restrictions or food allergies
